communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking official documentation related to the employment history of the persons listed below:

Cerelyn	Davis
James M. Ryall
Michael	Rallings
Toney	Armstrong
Larry	Godwin
James	Bolen
Walter	Crews
Bill	Oldham
Walter	Winfrey
Melvin	Burgess
James	Ivy

Specifically, I request the formal offer letter or employment agreement issued upon their commencement of the position. I am also interested in official documents regarding their departure, such as a resignation letter or termination notice.

Please provide the relevant documents, which specify their start and end dates (both as MM/DD/YYYY), and any other pertinent details relating to the type of separation and if they were internal/external to the Department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with John Navarro.

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: COPA comments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All comments submitted in response to the department's call for public input regarding the Certificate of Public Advantage or "COPA" application from Union Health and Terre Haute Regional Hospital.   

I’m requesting expedited processing due to a “compelling need” for the public, especially those living in this region of Indiana, to understand how this merger will impact their lives.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Liss
